# dokploy_volume_backups (Data Source)

Fetches the list of volume backups for a specific service in Dokploy.



<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `service_id` (String) ID of the service to list volume backups for.
- `service_type` (String) Type of service: application, postgres, mysql, mariadb, mongo, redis, or compose.

### Read-Only

- `volume_backups` (Attributes List) List of volume backups for the service. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--volume_backups))

<a id="nestedatt--volume_backups"></a>
### Nested Schema for `volume_backups`

Read-Only:

- `app_name` (String) Docker app/service name.
- `created_at` (String) Creation timestamp of the volume backup.
- `cron_expression` (String) Cron schedule for backups.
- `destination_id` (String) ID of the backup destination.
- `enabled` (Boolean) Whether the backup schedule is enabled.
- `id` (String) Unique identifier of the volume backup.
- `keep_latest_count` (Number) Number of recent backups to keep.
- `name` (String) Name of the volume backup configuration.
- `prefix` (String) Prefix for backup files in the destination storage.
- `service_name` (String) Service name within a compose stack.
- `service_type` (String) Type of service being backed up.
- `turn_off` (Boolean) Whether the service is stopped during backup.
- `volume_name` (String) Name of the Docker volume being backed up.
